content.question: In your response, be sure to address all parts of the question. Use complete sentences; an outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. Using the accompanying excerpts, answer (a), (b), and (c). (a) Briefly describe ONE important difference between Peiss’ and Enstad’s historical interpretations of women’s emergence in the public sphere at the turn of the twentieth century. (b) Briefly explain how ONE specific historical event, development, or circumstance from the period 1880–1929 that is not specifically mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Peiss’ argument. (c) Briefly explain how ONE specific historical event, development, or circumstance from the period 1880–1929 that is not specifically mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Enstad’s argument.
